Sentencas: In the first of a two part publication, the effect of fuel utilization (U-f) on carbon deposition rates in solid oxide fuel cell nickel-based anodes was studied.
Titulo: Carbon deposition thresholds on nickel-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes I. Fuel utilization

Sentencas: Representative 5-component CH4 reformate compositions (CH4, H-2, CO, H2O, & CO2) were selected graphically by plotting the solutions to a system of mass-balance constraint equations.
Titulo: Carbon deposition thresholds on nickel-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes I. Fuel utilization

Sentencas: The centroid of the solution space was chosen to represent a typical anode gas mixture for each nominal Uf value.
Titulo: Carbon deposition thresholds on nickel-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes I. Fuel utilization

Sentencas: Selected 5-component and 3-component gas mixtures were then delivered to anode-supported cells for 10 h, followed by determination of the resulting deposited carbon mass.
Titulo: Carbon deposition thresholds on nickel-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes I. Fuel utilization

Sentencas: The empirical carbon deposition thresholds were affected by atomic carbon (C), hydrogen (H), and oxygen (0) fractions of the delivered gas mixtures and temperature.
Titulo: Carbon deposition thresholds on nickel-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes I. Fuel utilization

Sentencas: It was also found that CH4-rich gas mixtures caused irreversible damage, whereas atomically equivalent CO-rich compositions did not.
Titulo: Carbon deposition thresholds on nickel-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes I. Fuel utilization

Sentencas: The coking threshold predicted by thermodynamic equilibrium calculations employing graphite for the solid carbon phase agreed well with empirical thresholds at 700 degrees C
Titulo: Carbon deposition thresholds on nickel-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes I. Fuel utilization

Sentencas: (Uf approximate to 32%); however, at 600 degrees C, poor agreement was observed with the empirical threshold of 36%.
Titulo: Carbon deposition thresholds on nickel-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes I. Fuel utilization

Sentencas: Finally, cell operating temperatures correlated well with the difference in enthalpy between the supplied anode gas mixtures and their resulting thermodynamic equilibrium gas mixtures.
Titulo: Carbon deposition thresholds on nickel-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes I. Fuel utilization
